title: Part A, B, and C
stimulusHtml:
The primary goals of this question are to assess a studentâ€™s ability to (1) explain the use of a control group in an experiment; (2) identify a confounding variable within an experiment; (3) generalize results of an experiment to an appropriate condition; and (4) use a graphical display to provide evidence for a decision.


Scoring

Parts (a), (b), and (c) are each scored as essentially correct (E), partially correct (P), or incorrect (I).
